labels.description: Issues or PRs related to documentation

labels.name: area/application-connector

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
3. Assign the Documentation project.
-->

**Description**
As the [AC module docs](https://kyma-project.io/#/application-connector-manager/user/README) are already visible on the Kyma website in the Modules section, the AC component docs should be removed.
<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of the potential documentation improvement.-->

**Area**
* Application Connector
* Documentation
<!-- Provide the area the document refers to. For example, write: 
* Application Connector
* Event Mesh
* Kyma Environment Broker -->

**Reasons**
The content is now duplicated.
<!-- Explain why we should improve the document. -->

**Assignees**
@grego952

- Central Gateway charts removed
- Central Application connectivity Validator charts removed
- Installation files removed
- Runtime overrides removed

Deadline: Kyma 2.20 release cutoff 30.10.2022

issue.title: Control rebuilding of new revision for multiple functions in multirepo

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: area/serverless
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to serverless

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: Issues accepted for development but not planned in the next 3 releases.

issue.body:
**Description**

Investigate how we can skip  rebuilding of a git sourced function for unrelevant changes in the new revisions

**Reason**

A kind of annoying problem with the git repo based functions. For any given repo base directory path any modification/commit even unrelated to a given function source code will trigger the re-build of all functions that are on the base directory path.  For instance whatever minor change in a readme file that is located somewhere in the base directory path will trigger the rebuild of all the functions they may be located there. 

If a monorepo is used for many functions all functions referencing the repository ( where a potentially harmless change  was committed; i.e README.md)  are queued for rebuilding and redeploying.

**Ideas**

 - in order to better control the re-build decisions we need to have cached sources
 - check for diffs  in the basedir only (assuming basedir is the horizon ) 
 - allow users to control the limiter (horizon), i.e define the parent dir that is relevant for serverless

comment.body:
@kyma-bot: Closing this issue.

>- After 60d of inactivity, `lifecycle/stale` is applied
>- After 7d of inactivity since `lifecycle/stale` was applied, the issue is closed
>
>You can:
>- Reopen this issue or PR with `/reopen`
>- Mark this issue or PR as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle stale`
>
>If you think that I work incorrectly, kindly [raise an issue](https://github.com/kyma-project/test-infra/issues/new/choose) with the problem.
>
>/close


Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md).  If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the [kubernetes/test-infra](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/new?title=Prow%20issue:) repository.
</details>

issue.title: Introduce a scheduler in serverless enabling users to trigger functions on a given schedule

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: area/serverless
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to serverless

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: Issues accepted for development but not planned in the next 3 releases.

issue.body:
**Description**

Introduce a scheduler in serverless enabling users to trigger functions on a given schedule.


**Reasons**
A time based function trigger is a valid use-case for FaaS and its currently missing in kyma serverless.
User has option to trigger function with k8s cronjobs, but this approach requires k8s knowledge from the user and is only suitable for long intervals. Otherwise there might be a resource problem ( cluttering the cluster )

**Assumptions**

 - The time trigger does not carry any input payload. It's like a "ping" signal
 - The time trigger does not originate from the function runtime itself - as it can be scaled down to zero and inactive
 - It should be investigated weather we make our controller responsible for triggering signal ( i.e via [cron library](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/robfig/cron) ) or should we delegate to k8s cronjobs?
 - User defines "cron"-like schedule for the function
 - Should user defines if the time precision is essential? (Might be a factor for scaled to zero functions in the period of inactivity )

**Attachments**
 - [Initial investigation](https://github.tools.sap/wookiee/documentation/pull/10)

comment.body:
@kyma-bot: Closing this issue.

>

>- After 60d of inactivity, `lifecycle/stale` is applied
>- After 7d of inactivity since `lifecycle/stale` was applied, the issue is closed
>
>You can:
>- Reopen this issue or PR with `/reopen`
>- Mark this issue or PR as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle stale`
>
>If you think that I work incorrectly, kindly [raise an issue](https://github.com/kyma-project/test-infra/issues/new/choose) with the problem.
>
>/close


Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md).  If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the [kubernetes/test-infra](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/new?title=Prow%20issue:) repository.
</details>

issue.title: Schedule build job with exponential back-off

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: area/serverless
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to serverless

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: Issues accepted for development but not planned in the next 3 releases.

issue.body:
**Description**

Schedule build jobs with k8s exponential backoff.



**Reason**
A failed build job is rescheduled after 5 minutes. We should schedule those jobs  with exponential back-off mechanism so that in case there are bad conditions on the cluster ( i.e CPU time shortage ), those builds can be re-tried.

issue.body:
**Description**
This tests:
https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/blob/main/components/function-controller/internal/webhook/defaulting_webhook_test.go#L121
checks how many operation was performend, which is insufficient.
This tests should also check what operation was performed
Currently the information about expected performed operations is written in comment and ages quickly.


**Reasons**
Improve tests.

**Attachments**

<!-- Attach any files, links, code samples, or screenshots that will convince us to your idea. -->

issue.title: Enable Java as Alpha Runtime  in Kyma Serverless

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: area/serverless
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to serverless

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

labels.name: 2023-Q3
labels.description: Planned for Q3 2023

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: Issues accepted for development but not planned in the next 3 releases.

issue.body:
**Description**

Define configuration for java runtime

 - define config map that introduces config for java runtime - (draft in progress - https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/pull/15910)
 - allow java runtime in the validation webhook
 - prove that Kyma serverless would be capable to build, package and serve a java application as a function.
 

**AC**
 - java runtime shoud be allowed only if feature flag is enabled. If FF enabled:
   - User should be able to set "java-alpha" in the `spec.runtime` field.
    - User should be able to provide java source code and dependencies
    - Function should build and be scheduled as a pod
 - Include java in the integration tests

issue.title: Enable Java as Alpha Runtime  in Kyma Serverless

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: area/serverless
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to serverless

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

labels.name: 2023-Q3
labels.description: Planned for Q3 2023

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: Issues accepted for development but not planned in the next 3 releases.

issue.body:
**Description**

Define configuration for java runtime

 - define config map that introduces config for java runtime - (draft in progress - https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/pull/15910)
 - allow java runtime in the validation webhook
 - prove that Kyma serverless would be capable to build, package and serve a java application as a function.
 

**AC**
 - java runtime shoud be allowed only if feature flag is enabled. If FF enabled:
   - User should be able to set "java-alpha" in the `spec.runtime` field.
    - User should be able to provide java source code and dependencies
    - Function should build and be scheduled as a pod
 - Include java in the integration tests
